ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Surname
ygData.msgSnippet: Fortisimo (Ff) means very loud.  Pianisimo (Pp) means very soft.  You could also try something like Fortzando (a surge of..loudness).  Music theory related
ygData.messageBody:
Fortisimo (Ff) means very loud. Pianisimo (Pp) means very soft. You could also try something like Fortzando (a surge of..loudness). Music theory related terms always make good surnames, imho.

----- Original Message -----
From: Sylly Songsynger
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 03, 2000 5:00 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Surname


Congratulations! WTG!! Grats!

I remember level 20 as the first really great achievement. And even now I
think it is the "best" accomplishment in the game - getting your first
surname. When I was level 20, all I knew was that surname really made you
different. Ya either had one or not. At that point level 50 was so distant
that it was not even a consideration. Level 20 and then level 32 - that
defined you as a real bard.

Skarsol Singzemol
Skarsol Playzemol
Skarsol du'Aria
Skarsol Fortisimo (not sure what that means but sounds cool no?)

Sylly Songsynger

----- Original Message -----
From: "Rains, Darryl" <dsrains@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, April 03, 2000 2:51 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Surname


> Hiya fellow songsters.
>
> I finally made 20th level yesterday. It has been a long hard trip so far.
I
> don't see how a lot of you guys move up so fast. I am lucky if I can gain
1
> level per week. Anyway, I was wondering if you have any ideas for a good
> surname. I figured ya'll had probably seen, or thought about it a lot more
> than I have. I was thinking of using Windsong. Suggestions?
>
> Skarsol
> Bard of the 20th song
> Cazic Thule
